boardgame.name: Lectio
Lexio
렉시오
boardgame.description: Lectio (previously known as Lexio) is based on the traditional Chinese game system of _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Zheng Shangyou_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; the climbing game _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; and is virtually the same game as Big Two (also known as Chinese Poker). Many other card games are based on the same mechanism (The Great Dalmuti, Gang of Four, Tichu, etc.), but Lectio uses tiles similar to those in Mah Jong instead of cards, and they are of excellent construction. In accordance with Chinese tradition, the number _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;2_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; is the strongest number. The suits are named after the sun, the moon, the stars, and the wind._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In the game, a player leads a tile or set of tiles, and the other players must follow by either playing a higher tile or set of tiles or passing. The play continues until all players have passed in succession after the final play, and the player who played the last set leads next. Play continues until one player has played all of his tiles. Then each player pays chips to those players who performed better _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; that is, the player who went out will get paid by all other players, and the other players pay points to one another based on the difference in the number of tiles each held at the end of the hand. A game lasts five rounds, and the player at the end of the game with the most points wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgameversion: Dagoy Black edition with Francesca Box

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

Shipping within Europe: 14€
The game includes Korean, German any English rules, the tiles veriosn are the white ones and there is also a bag included.

Buyer pays shipping of $13.00 in the Continental US. As for the money chips, there are 23 yellow, 24 red and 20 green. This means the game is missing one red money chip. All players starts with 5 red, so in a 5-player game, there will be one missing red. (However, I will say, while the components are generally great, these chips are awful and would do well to be replaced with poker chips.) Also, there is no bag. I don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t know what bag they are talking about either. I have the black edition, and it has no bag. I read something about a travel bag, so maybe that_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s what they mean? But anyway, this is the Dagoy White 2005 edition.
Otherwise, unplayed and new.
Shipping included for USA.
